prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0375, 0.09, 0.0] Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying a rotation using the Euler angles and a translation using the translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch to a depth of 0.03 units towards the normal vector and no extrusion in the opposite direction. The final shape has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.03 - Height: 0.75 **Part 2: Construct a CAD model of two rectangular prisms, one on top of the other.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.195, 0.06, 0.0] Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Transform both 2D sketches into 3D sketches by applying a rotation using the Euler angles and a translation using the translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the first sketch to a depth of 0.06 units towards the normal vector and no extrusion in the opposite direction. Join the resulting 3D model with a second 3D model, which is created by extruding the second sketch to a depth of 0.06 units towards the normal vector and no extrusion in the opposite direction.
